definition: to hit a wall/(fig.) to hit a brick wall/to hit a snag/to have the door slammed in one's face

sentences.english: By my fourth week of daily drawing, I hit a wall.
sentences.chinese: 在堅持每天創作的第四周裏，我碰壁了。

sentences.english: Everywhere runs into a wall, I think that time, own definitely can rude awakening.
sentences.chinese: 處處碰壁，我覺得那個時候，自己肯定會後悔莫及。

sentences.english: Job-hunting has failed again and again. It has made me terribly upset.
sentences.chinese: 找工作處處碰壁，搞得我心亂如麻。

definition: to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to keep on fighting despite continual setbacks (idiom)
setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
to return in low spirits following a defeat or failure to achieve one's ambitions (idiom)
to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
see 吃閉門羹|吃闭门羹[chi1 bi4 men2 geng1]
to have high standards but little ability/to be fastidious but incompetent (idiom)
